pr_title: Empty extension should not be serialized

timeline.bodyText: This method sounds very strange. I'm not convinced this method is well placed. For serialization purpose, why the serializer is not responsible to determine if an extension should be serialized or not?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Yes indeed, that would be more consistent...
replies.author: flo-dup

timeline.bodyText: I think this method should be define on the SlackTerminal API, not for the all extensions (that could concern everything in powsybl, not necessarily IIDM extensions)
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Yes (like it was before that PR), if the serializer is responsible of checking if the serialization is needed, there's no need for that in all the extesions. And what about the name btw, isCleanable / isEmpty?
replies.author: flo-dup

timeline.bodyText: I would use the serializer to check if an extension should be serialized or not.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: I think we really need to cache the extension list for an identifiable, to not iterate several times over the same list.
timeline.author: mathbagu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -217,15 +215,14 @@ private static void writeExtensions(Network n, NetworkXmlWriterContext context,
 
             Collection<? extends Extension<? extends Identifiable<?>>> extensions = identifiable.getExtensions().stream()
                     .filter(e -> options.withExtension(e.getName()))
+                    .filter(e -> !e.isEmpty())

replies.bodyText: Indeed, it's done twice when writing the xml: first for the namespaces, then for the extension itslef
replies.author: flo-dup

replies.bodyText: Edit: It's now computed only once, when creating the NetworkXmlWriterContext
replies.author: flo-dup

timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I don't think so, it's always true because of the filter a few lines above
replies.author: flo-dup
